title: Incorrect package name when copying package in jdt.ui
description: When attempting to copy a package in the jdt.ui plugin using the 'copy package' feature, the resulting package name is incorrect. The steps are as follows: 1. Open the jdt.ui plugin in Eclipse. 2. Find the package 'xxx' and select it. 3. Right-click on the package and choose the 'copy package' option. 4. Enter 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' as the destination package name. As a result, instead of creating a package with the name 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui', a package with the name 'ui' is created in the destination folder.
OB: The package 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' is not created. Only a package with the name 'ui' is created in the destination folder.
EB: The 'copy package' feature should create a package with the name 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' in the destination folder.
SR: 1. Open the jdt.ui plugin in Eclipse. 2. Find the package 'xxx' and select it. 3. Right-click on the package and choose the 'copy package' option. 4. Enter 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' as the destination package name. Check that a package with the name 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' is created in the destination folder, not just a package with the name 'ui'.
